text: The Wigan Warriors play Rugby League in Wigan, England. Their 2017 season results in the Super League XXII, 2017 Challenge Cup, and 2017 World Club Series are shown below. ==World Club Series== As winners of the 2016 Super League Grand Final, Wigan Warriors qualified for the 2017 World Club Series. The game saw them play Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks whom they beat providing the Super League's first ever win in the World Club Series era of the tournament. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:85%;" !Date !Opponent !H/A !Result !Scorers !Att. |- style="background:#ddffdd |19th February 2017 | Cronulla- Sutherland Sharks |H |22–6 | |21,011 |- |} ==Super League== Wigan's Super League form was relatively poor durind the 2017 season. The years was the first time they had lost ten more games since 2009, and the first time they had failed to qualify for the play-offs since style="background:#ffdddd;" | 23rd September 2017 | Wakefield Trinity | A | 0–32 | | 5,155 | |- |} ====Table==== ==Challenge Cup== As a "Super 8s" team of the 2016 Super League, Wigan Warriors entered the 2017 Challenge Cup in the sixth round where they beat Championship's Swinton Lions. The quarter finals saw them beat local rivals Warrington Wolves by a single point. In the semi-finals Warriors beat Salford Red Devils, before finishing runners-up at Wembley to Hull F.C.. The final was their first final since 2013. {| class="wikitable" style="font- size:85%;" !Date !Round !Opponent !H/A !Result !Scorers !Att. |- style="background:#ddffdd |14th May 2017 |Sixth Round | Swinton Lions |A |42–12 | |2,003 |- style="background:#ddffdd |17th June 2017 |Quarter Final | Warrington Wolves |A |27–26 | |7,312 |- style="background:#ddffdd |30th July 2017 |Semi Final | Salford Red Devils |N |27–14 | |10,796 |- style="background:#ffdddd |26th August 2017 |Final | Hull F.C. |N |14–18 | |68,525 |- |} ==References== Category:Wigan Warriors seasons Category:2017 in English rugby league
